thread.title: Ian Wright launches foul-mouthed rant at Arsenal following embarrassing 5-1 Bayern Munich defeat
thread.title_full: Ian Wright launches foul-mouthed rant at Arsenal following embarrassing 5-1 Bayern Munich defeat

author: sstreet
title: Ian Wright launches foul-mouthed rant at Arsenal following embarrassing 5-1 Bayern Munich defeat
text:
'A f shambles' Ian Wright launches foul-mouthed rant at Arsenal following embarrassing 5-1 Bayern Munich defeat 
SunSport columnist couldn't believe what he was seeing while Martin Keown suggested Arsene Wenger should consider his future By CHARLIE WYETT Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ARSENAL legend Ian Wright branded Arsene Wenger’s flops a “ g shambles” after last night’s Champions League humiliation. 
And the gutless Gunners were labelled “spineless” and “rudderless” after Bayern’s rampage. We are a g shambles 😫 
— Ian Wright (@IanWright0) February 15, 2017 Getty Images Arsenal were humiliated by Bayern Munich at the Allianz Arena 
And the gutless Gunners were labelled “spineless” and “rudderless” following Bayern’s rampage. 
Wrighty tweeted: “We are a g shambles. At least let it go to the g home leg. **** it !!! Not watching anymore.” At least let it go to the g home leg 🙏🙏🙏 
— Ian Wright (@IanWright0) February 15, 2017 **** it !!! Not watching anymore. 😡 
— Ian Wright (@IanWright0) February 15, 2017 
Boss Wenger is on the verge of crashing out at the first knockout stage for the SEVENTH YEAR in a row — probably ending his 20-year Emirates reign. 
Keep up to date with ALL the ARSENAL news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club pages plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Former Arsenal defender Martin Keown said: “I feel for Arsene Wenger, this is obviously his lowest point ever at Arsenal. 
“He must be seriously considering his future because that was embarrassing.” PA:Press Association Ian Wright couldn’t believe Arsenal’s dreadful performance Getty Images The Gunners were put to the sword by Bayern Munich Getty Images Arsenal’s players stand in disbelief PA:Press Association 8 The scoreboard said it all 
Keown, who played in Wenger’s Invincibles side in 2003-04, added: “I can’t say I’d like to see him go when you have won things. He’s like a footballing father. 
“But I’ll be surprised if he is there next season because of the way things are going. It is spiralling down and down and down and out of control.” Where's your shame, Wenger? 
— Piers Morgan (@piersmorgan) February 15, 2017 We've collapsed since you left us …….we've gone from invincible to invisibles😡 https://t.co/GB0LqeKOet 
— AP McCoy (@AP_McCoy) February 15, 2017 Bad night! freezing my nuts off and we collapse second half. 😖 Gutted 
— Ray Parlour (@RealRomfordPele) February 15, 2017 Related Stories MARK HALSEY Arsenal can have no complaints with the referee, they were lucky Bayern Munich didn't have a penalty five things WE LEARNT Arjen Robben was brilliant, Mesut Ozil went missing and Arsenal are too reliant on Laurent Koscielny BAY, BYE ARSENE Bayern Munich 5-1 Arsenal: Arsene Wenger's flops cave in at Allianz Arena as they head for seventh straight Champions League last-16 exit after embarrassing defeat Preview Sutton United vs Arsenal: What time does it kick-off, what TV channel is it on, and what is the latest team news? Under the Kosc Laurent Koscielny goes off injured for Arsenal... and Bayern Munich score three in ten minutes RAFA QUELLS ARSENAL TALK Rafa Benitez is focused on Toon despite talk he'll replace Arsene Wenger at Arsenal tweet wars Bayern Munich begin mind games ahead of Champions League clash by tweeting Arsenal team BEFORE Gunners 
Gary Lineker added: “Arsenal have completely disintegrated. An utter shambles and rudderless.” 
And fellow BT pundit Rio Ferdinand rapped: “They were spineless. Arsenal got dismantled. 
“You want to see someone with a bit of fire in their belly. I don’t see it in this team.” Getty Images Martin Keown says the manager must consider his future AP:Associated Press Arsene Wenger looked crestfallen in Munich Reuters 8 Arjen Robben celebrates his goal 
Arjen Robben put Carlo Ancelotti’s side ahead before Alexis Sanchez’s 20th goal of the season gave Gunners hope of ending their Munich hoodoo. 
But Bayern took 178 seconds to kill off Wenger for the fourth time in 12 years as Robert Lewandowski and Thiago Alcantara scored in a brutal second-half spell. Wenger, Koscielny and Ancelotti pre Bayern Munich v Arsenal Champions League tie 
Thiago got No 4 six minutes later and Thomas Muller a late fifth to make the return at the Emirates on March 7 a formality. Arsenal have completely disintegrated. An utter shambles and rudderless after koscielny went off. 
— Gary Lineker (@GaryLineker) February 15, 2017 No change there but they may now realise that I was right all along. Arsenal are soft and have been for a long time. https://t.co/4jNEY5yRZQ 
— michael owen (@themichaelowen) February 15, 2017 
Wenger, 67, was back on the touchline for the first time after four-game domestic ban following last month’s bust-up with the fourth official. 
But he saw Arsenal became first English side to concede 200 Champions League goals.
